intro: Rivea collinsiae, commonly known as the Collins' morning glory, is a climbing vine native to South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant produces violet to blue flowers with a prominent white throat, and it blooms throughout the growing season. Rivea collinsiae is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing habits. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens.
